meanings.definition: To coat (a metal, especially aluminum) with a protective oxide layer by electrolysis.
meanings.sent1: The factory will anodise the aluminum sheets for durability.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to anodise aluminum to prevent corrosion.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chef anodise the metal pot? To keep it shiny!
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to anodise his heart, protecting it from further pain.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand could anodise any metal with a wave.

meanings.sent1: The technician will anodise the metal parts to enhance their properties.
meanings.sent2: They decided to anodise the bike frame to give it a sleek look.
meanings.sent3: The aliens wanted to anodise the spaceship for intergalactic travel.
meanings.sent4: His smile seemed to anodise the room, making everyone feel warm.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush could anodise any surface with vibrant colors.
